verses.name: Song of Songs 2:1
verses.text: Ego flos campi,  et lilium convallium.

verses.name: Song of Songs 2:2
verses.text: Sicut lilium inter spinas,  sic amica mea inter filias.

verses.name: Song of Songs 2:3
verses.text: Sicut malus inter ligna silvarum,  sic dilectus meus inter filios.  Sub umbra illius quem desideraveram sedi,  et fructus ejus dulcis gutturi meo.

verses.name: Song of Songs 2:4
verses.text: Introduxit me in cellam vinariam ;  ordinavit in me caritatem.

verses.name: Song of Songs 2:5
verses.text: Fulcite me floribus,  stipate me malis,  quia amore langueo.

verses.name: Song of Songs 2:6
verses.text: Læva ejus sub capite meo,  et dextera illius amplexabitur me.

verses.name: Song of Songs 2:7
verses.text: Adjuro vos, filiæ Jerusalem,  per capreas cervosque camporum,  ne suscitetis, neque evigilare faciatis dilectam,  quoadusque ipsa velit.

verses.name: Song of Songs 2:8
verses.text: Vox dilecti mei ; ecce iste venit,  saliens in montibus, transiliens colles.

verses.name: Song of Songs 2:9
verses.text: Similis est dilectus meus capreæ,  hinnuloque cervorum.  En ipse stat post parietem nostrum,  respiciens per fenestras,  prospiciens per cancellos.

verses.name: Song of Songs 2:10
verses.text: En dilectus meus loquitur mihi.     Surge, propera, amica mea,  columba mea, formosa mea, et veni :

verses.name: Song of Songs 2:11
verses.text: jam enim hiems transiit ;  imber abiit, et recessit.

verses.name: Song of Songs 2:12
verses.text: Flores apparuerunt in terra nostra ;  tempus putationis advenit :  vox turturis audita est in terra nostra ;

verses.name: Song of Songs 2:13
verses.text: ficus protulit grossos suos ;  vineæ florentes dederunt odorem suum.  Surge, amica mea, speciosa mea, et veni :

verses.name: Song of Songs 2:14
verses.text: columba mea, in foraminibus petræ, in caverna maceriæ,  ostende mihi faciem tuam,  sonet vox tua in auribus meis :  vox enim tua dulcis, et facies tua decora.

verses.name: Song of Songs 2:15
verses.text: Capite nobis vulpes parvulas  quæ demoliuntur vineas :  nam vinea nostra floruit.

verses.name: Song of Songs 2:16
verses.text: Dilectus meus mihi, et ego illi,  qui pascitur inter lilia,

verses.name: Song of Songs 2:17
verses.text: donec aspiret dies, et inclinentur umbræ.  Revertere ; similis esto, dilecte mi, capreæ,  hinnuloque cervorum super montes Bether.
